page.title: 06St. Augustine's Church
page.content: Built for the growing population of Whitchurch,this ecumenical centre was dedicated by the Bishop of Bristol in 1972. Its flexible design caters for the many groups that meet there,such as Playgroups,Brownies,Guides,the Elderly,Drama and Dance.Part of the wall between the Church and hall can be removed enlarging the Church for special occasions. The modern beechwood furniture is movable too.The font is Norman,the bell 18th century.The modern windows by Michael Hutchins are the colours of the spectrum.The Pascoe sculpture of Christ on a cross is most striking. After 13 years of frequent safety checks the bell tower had to be demolished & design & building faults necessitated the strengthening of foundations & walls.
